2025_promote_OS: Yes, this is my motivation for doing so:
2025_promote_OS_2_TEXT: I just think it is important part of our role as academics
new2025_OER: I am not necessarily the owner of copyright on such materials - so it is not up to me to decide.
uni_support: Easy guidelines on what types of materials can be shared and how; better institutional/structural incentives
oscl_support: I think the OSCL already does a lot - it is just a long-term, bottom-up process to involve and motivate all the stakeholders. Generally, peer-to-peer learning is the most effective
RR_how: We are asked to list OS in grant applications - I suppose we should be rewarded for this, but whether it actually matters remains an open question.
RR_ideal: It should matter for promotions in a structured manner - otherwise it is just a lip service. All hiring/promotion decisions should be motivated explicitly in reference to open science as well.
